channel.title: Zsh on jdhao's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Zsh on jdhao's blog

item.title: Notes on Zsh history feature
item.description: My notes on setting up history-related features for zsh.

item.title: My Experience with Several Zsh Plugin Managers
item.description: In this post, I share my experience and opinions on several popular Zsh plugin managers.

item.title: Binding Keys in Zsh
item.description: In this post, I want to share how to use bindkeys command to solve a few issues when using Zsh.

item.title: Boosting Your Productivity on Terminal with Zsh and Plugins
item.description: In my previous post, I have introduced how to build Zsh from source and install oh-my-zsh to enhance your terminal experience. In this post, I’d like to show you how to manage plugins with zplug and a few more plugins to boost your productivity.

item.title: Faster Directory Navigation with z.lua
item.description: If you work with terminals extensively, you may be tired of typing cd to go to directories, especially when directory names are very long. z.lua is such a tool to make your life easier by jumping to the desired directory smartly.

item.title: Building Zsh from Source and Configuring It on CentOS
item.description:
Update: this is my first post on Zsh install and configuration. For a list of useful plugins I use to boost my productivity, see this post.

Zsh is a powerful shell with better auto-completion and richer features. There are also various plugins to enrich your experience of using Zsh. In this post, I will give a brief summary on how to install and set up zsh.
